place.name: RUCKLAND
place.gazetteerText: RUCKLAND, a parish in Louth district, Lincoln; 4½ miles W S W of Anthorpe r. station, and 6 S of Louth. Post-town, Louth. Acres, 713. Real property, £820. Pop., 46. Houses, 7. The manor belongs to J. W. Dawber, Esq. R. House is the residence of J. Heanley, Esq. The living is a rectory, united with Farforth and Maidenwell, in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £315.* Patron, the Earl of Yarborough. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
